title: Creating a reading list of articles on causal inference in the context of machine learning (ML) and natural language processing (NLP) is a great way to delve into this important area of research. Here’s a list of 20 articles up to 2022 that cover various aspects of causality, including causal discovery and causal effects
Causal inference in statistics: An overview
container-title: *Statistics Surveys*. This foundational paper provides a comprehensive overview of causal inference

title: *Elements of Causal Inference: Foundations and Learning Algorithms*. This book is essential for understanding the theoretical underpinnings of causal inference
*Causation, Prediction, and Search*. This book introduces algorithms for causal discovery
*Causal Inference in Statistics: A Primer*. This primer is a great starting point for understanding causal inference in statistics
Causality for Machine Learning
note: *arXiv preprint arXiv:1911.10500*. This paper discusses the role of causality in machine learning.

title: Causal inference and the data-fusion problem
container-title: *Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences*. This paper addresses causal inference in the context of data fusion

title: Causal effect inference with deep latent-variable models
container-title: *Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)*. This paper explores causal effect inference using deep learning

title: Causal consistency of structural equation models
container-title: *Proceedings of the 33rd Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI)*. This paper discusses causal consistency in structural equation models

title: Multi-source domain adaptation: A causal view
container-title: *Proceedings of the Twenty-Ninth AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI)*. This paper presents a causal perspective on domain adaptation

title: Theoretical Impediments to Machine Learning With Seven Sparks from the Causal Revolution
container-title: *Proceedings of the Eleventh ACM International Conference on Web Search and Data Mining (WSDM)*. This paper discusses the challenges of integrating causality into machine learning

title: A survey on causal inference
container-title: *ACM Transactions on Knowledge Discovery from Data (TKDD)*. This survey provides a comprehensive overview of causal inference methods

title: Learning neural causal models from unknown interventions
note: *arXiv preprint arXiv:1910.01075*. This paper explores learning causal models with neural networks.

title: Causal inference in NLP: Estimation, prediction, interpretation and beyond
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2021 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP)*. This paper discusses causal inference applications in NLP

title: Adapting text embeddings for causal inference
container-title: *Proceedings of the 36th Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI)*. This paper explores adapting text embeddings for causal inference

title: Path-specific counterfactual fairness
container-title: *Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence*. This paper discusses fairness in machine learning from a causal perspective

title: Counterfactual fairness
container-title: *Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)*. This paper introduces the concept of counterfactual fairness

title: The sensitivity of counterfactual fairness to unmeasured confounding
container-title: *Proceedings of the 37th International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML)*. This paper examines the impact of unmeasured confounding on counterfactual fairness

title: The blessings of multiple causes
container-title: *Journal of the American Statistical Association*. This paper discusses causal inference with multiple causes

title: Invariant risk minimization
note: *arXiv preprint arXiv:1907.02893*. This paper introduces invariant risk minimization, a method for learning causal representations.

title: Anchor regression: Heterogeneous data meets causality
container-title: *Journal of the Royal Statistical Society: Series B (Statistical Methodology)*
note: This paper presents anchor regression, a method for causal inference with heterogeneous data.

title: These articles and books provide a solid foundation for understanding causal inference in ML and NLP, covering both theoretical and practical aspects
